page.title: 11Barton Village
page.content:
The village of Barton lies about five miles north of Preston in the county of Lancashire.
Much of Barton is agricultural land, being used mainly as grazing for cattle and sheep. However, there is a ribbon of housing which straggles along the main road and spreads to the east in two small and seperate areas of modern housing. There is also an area, not included in this setion of the survey, which forms a large part of Broughton Village.
There is thus no centre to the village. Activities in the village centre on the village hall and the scout hut, both of which lie on the northern edge of this survey area.
